result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel A. Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joel A. Stewart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joel A. Stewart was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling as recommended by the Agent
Clerk of Courts will collect fines/costs

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel A. Stewart

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Joel A. Stewart in court with attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 and 16TR2451.  Ct. 2 along with 16TR2450 to be dismissed.  Atty Wilsnack agrees.  Defendant agrees except for the ignition interlock.  Atty Hendee asks that the traffic matter be set for another date and he and the defendant can meet further on that matter so today will just be the criminal matter.
Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea to the criminal charge.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee states that both traffic matters will be set for a pre-trial conference.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on April 1, 2017

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
Return date on March 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Return date on February 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
16TR2450 & 16Tr2451 are tracking w/16CM134

Defendant Joel A. Stewart in court with attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant states that Atty Wilsnack is not here.  Atty Hendee will check with Ms. Runge from treatment court.  Defendant would like to get to work.  
Court will recess for 3 minutes to call Atty Wilsnack.
Atty Wilsnack now appears with the defendant.  
Atty Hendee states that he met with the defendant for a pre-trial and in the meantime, Atty Wilsnack is now on the case.  Atty Wilsnack agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued  Return date scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
16TR2450 and 16TR2451 were reopened and track w/16CM134 per DA

Pre-trial conference on December 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Return date on January 5, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joel A. Stewart in court.   Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16TR2450 & 16TR2451 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
 Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.   Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and Pre-Trial
16TR2450 & 16TR2451 tracking  Return date scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 02:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
